bibl.author: William Sloane Kennedy
bibl.title: William Sloane Kennedy to Walt Whitman, 12 January 1891
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839â€“1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: Have got back, & copied out fair (add ring to) the Dutch paper. I think it has value, but it can be but a sketch (suggestions). I send it this A.M. to Stoddart. You will like it. Told him I hand over to you if not used, or to Traubel. Thank you Traubel for the Shillaber paper. We shall undoubtedly use in whole or nearly so. It did me good to hear that somebody in the world believes in me & thinks kindly of me. I shall emerge—when it suits me.
